scenes.title: The Letter
scenes.narration_text: Vikram and Vaibhavi received a letter from their Daadi. She was happy they had recovered from their illness using her natural cures.
scenes.visual_prompt: Vikram and Vaibhavi reading a handwritten letter from their grandmother (Daadi). They look happy.

scenes.title: Turmeric (Haldi)
scenes.narration_text: Daadi wrote about the magic spices in her kitchen. First, Haldi or Turmeric. 'Haldi improves energy and digestion. It also reduces body pain.'
scenes.visual_prompt: Daadi in her kitchen holding a spoonful of bright yellow turmeric powder.

scenes.title: Fenugreek (Methi)
scenes.narration_text: Next was Methi or Fenugreek. 'Methi helps control sugar levels and weight. I soak the seeds overnight and drink the water in the morning.'
scenes.visual_prompt: Daadi soaking brown fenugreek seeds in a glass of water.

scenes.title: Cumin and Asafoetida
scenes.narration_text: She remembered when they were babies. 'When you had tummy gas, I used Heeng water for relief. And Jeera water helps with sleep and digestion.'
scenes.visual_prompt: A baby crying with a tummy ache, then smiling after Daadi applies Heeng water.

scenes.title: Cinnamon, Clove, and Ginger
scenes.narration_text: 'Dalchini (Cinnamon) and Laung (Clove) help with toothaches. And Adrak (Ginger)? It's been used for 4000 years for coughs, colds, and pain!'
scenes.visual_prompt: Close up of Cinnamon sticks, Cloves, and fresh Ginger root on a wooden table.

scenes.title: The After-Meal Digestives
scenes.narration_text: 'That's why we eat Saunf and Elaichi after meals. They help digestion and cure bad breath.'
scenes.visual_prompt: A family finishing a meal and eating Fennel (Saunf) and Cardamom (Elaichi) from a small bowl.

scenes.title: The Advice
scenes.narration_text: Daadi finished her letter with important advice. 'Natural cures are passed down for generations. But remember, always consult an elder before using them!'
scenes.visual_prompt: Vikram and Vaibhavi in the kitchen, looking at the spice jars with new respect.
